intro: Beschorneria multiflora, commonly known as the Mexican feather plant, is a striking evergreen perennial native to Mexico. It features tall, narrow, grass-like leaves that are often used in floral arrangements due to their ornamental appearance. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers during the spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its resilience and attractive foliage make it a popular choice for both garden landscapes and indoor cultivation.
